channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Near top end of Floyd Road, 10th October
item.description:
Mattres, bin bags etc etc have been removed (thank you) but now someone has dumped a baby's pram. Will RBG use some of this £60 million for special projects to CATCH the fly tippers and CLEAN UP THIS DISGUSTING SPOT in Charlton?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin collection, 10th October
item.description:
Hackney continue to collect bins from Pritchards Road at 5am every week yet they don’t cover this area. Only stared Oct 24. 10+ years of post 8am collections.. The disruption is making me suicidal. These buildings are 90 years old. We hear/feel everything.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Regents Row, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Digital advert lighting up the whole street, 10th October
item.description:
The new digital advert on the corner of Bateman’s Row / Shoreditch High Street is so bright it is lighting up the whole street. The lights flash on and off, lighting up my flat over 100 meters away on New Inn Broadway.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoreditch High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish everywhere, 10th October
item.description:
The pictures show exactly the state of Kashgar Road! How often do the roads and pavements get swept clean? Its disgusting and people have started to contribute their rubbish to the current mess. Am happy to clean it up if you refund my council tax ive paid for the year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kashgar Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes parked on tactile paving, 10th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frampton Park Road, Hackney, London
